New Records: Giorgi Mamardashvili made 11 saves for Georgia in this match, only one goalkeeper on record (since 1980) making more in a game at the UEFA European Championship: Latvia’s Alexanders Kolinko versus Netherlands in 2004 (12).
Georges Mikautadze became the sixth player to score both of his nation’s first two goals at the UEFA European Championship, and first since Andriy Shevchenko in 2012 for Ukraine.
Key Match Events: Georgia earned a historic first point at a major international tournament as an independent nation.
Georges Mikautadze confidently slotted home to score the latest first-half goal – clocked at 48:20 – in European Championship history and send Georgia into the unlikeliest of half-time leads.
Patrik Schick scored the equaliser with his seventh attempt of the game, chesting the ball into an empty net from a yard out after Ondrej Lingr’s header had hit the post.
Saba Lobjanidze put a golden chance over the bar with the very last kick of the game after Georgia made a rare break up the field.
Pre-Game Insights: Since losing three in a row between June and September 2023, Georgia have only lost two of their last nine games (W4 D3).
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia’s coach praised their team’s resilience and determination after the match.
Patrik Schick limped off holding his calf midway through the second half, which dealt a big blow to the Czech Republic’s attacking threat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 24-team European Championship format has its problems, but it does mean a greater chance of stories like that of lowly Georgia playing on the grandest stage.
Czech Republic recorded 12 shots on target against Georgia; the most by a team who failed to win the match at the UEFA European Championship on record (since 1980).
Others: Georgia hung in there, with Giorgi Mamardashvili making as many saves (eight) by half-time as any other goalkeeper has in an entire match at Euro 2024 so far (Gianluigi Donnarumma and Thomas Strakosha have both made eight in a full game).
The Czechs knew they needed a huge second half and they went all out for an equaliser.
